channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: The U.S. falters again in figure skating, but the women still have time to make it up
item.description: Alysa Liu finished the night in third place, Isabeau Levito finished in eighth and Amber Glenn is in 13th place after a popped jump. That puts extra pressure on all of them for Thursday's medal event.
item.content:encoded:
Alysa Liu finished the night in third place, Isabeau Levito finished in eighth and Amber Glenn is in 13th place after a popped jump. That puts extra pressure on all of them for Thursday's medal event.

(Image credit: Wang Zhao)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Cities ditch license plate readers over privacy worries
item.description: Cities around the country are debating whether to keep their automatic license plate readers. Concerns about privacy and federal immigration agents can access local data are driving these debates.
item.content:encoded: Cities around the country are debating whether to keep their automatic license plate readers. Concerns about privacy and federal immigration agents can access local data are driving these debates.
item.dc:creator: Jude Joffe-Block

item.title: U.S. releases new details on alleged secret Chinese nuclear test
item.description: At a event in Washington D.C., A U.S. official said a remote earthquake in 2020 was caused by a Chinese nuclear test.
item.content:encoded:
At a event in Washington D.C., A U.S. official said a remote earthquake in 2020 was caused by a Chinese nuclear test.

(Image credit: Kevin Frayer)
item.dc:creator: Geoff Brumfiel

item.title: Rev. Jesse Jackson has died. And, U.S. and Iran set for high-stakes nuclear talks
item.description: Longtime civil rights leader Rev. Jesse Jackson dies at age 84. And, the U.S. and Iran are set for high-stakes negotiations today in Geneva about Iran's nuclear program.
item.content:encoded:
Longtime civil rights leader Rev. Jesse Jackson dies at age 84. And, the U.S. and Iran are set for high-stakes negotiations today in Geneva about Iran's nuclear program.

(Image credit: Harold Cunningham)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Rev. Jesse Jackson dies at 84
item.description: NPR's Michel Martin talks about the life of Rev. Jesse Jackson, an American civil rights leader, minister, and politician, who died Tuesday at the age of 84.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Michel Martin talks about the life of Rev. Jesse Jackson, an American civil rights leader, minister, and politician, who died Tuesday at the age of 84.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: Dr. Eddie Glaude talks about Rev. Jesse Jackson's legacy
item.description: NPR's Leila Fadel talks to author and scholar Dr. Eddie Glaude about the life and legacy of Rev. Jesse Jackson, who died Tuesday at the age of 84.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Leila Fadel talks to author and scholar Dr. Eddie Glaude about the life and legacy of Rev. Jesse Jackson, who died Tuesday at the age of 84.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: The record-breaking cocaine boom â€” and its deadly fallout
item.description: Cocaine has made a roaring comeback, and it's having some big negative effects in the U.S. and around the world.
item.content:encoded:
Cocaine has made a roaring comeback, and it's having some big negative effects in the U.S. and around the world.

(Image credit: LUIS ROBAYO)
item.dc:creator: Greg Rosalsky

item.title: Longtime civil rights leader the Rev. Jesse Jackson dies at 84
item.description: The Rev. Jesse Jackson was a lifelong civil rights advocate until his death Tuesday at the age of 84.
item.content:encoded:
The Rev. Jesse Jackson was a lifelong civil rights advocate until his death Tuesday at the age of 84.

(Image credit: Jason Mendez)
item.dc:creator: Jaclyn Diaz

item.title: Immigration crackdown in Maine is a top issue in battle for key Senate seat
item.description: President Trump's immigration policy is complicating Republicans' attempts to maintain control of Congress. A recent crackdown in Maine, for instance, put the focus on GOP Sen. Susan Collins.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump's immigration policy is complicating Republicans' attempts to maintain control of Congress. A recent crackdown in Maine, for instance, put the focus on GOP Sen. Susan Collins.

(Image credit: Joseph Prezioso)
item.dc:creator: Kevin Miller

item.title: Minnesota Republicans defend their focus on fraud despite the ICE surge that followed
item.description: Minnesota Republicans say they were right to invite social media influencers into the state to highlight social service fraud, though Democrats blame Republicans for paving the way for the ICE surge.
item.content:encoded:
Minnesota Republicans say they were right to invite social media influencers into the state to highlight social service fraud, though Democrats blame Republicans for paving the way for the ICE surge.

(Image credit: Brendan Smialowski)
item.dc:creator: Dana Ferguson
